result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Alejandro Beltran-Vega was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescription medication taken as prescribed.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

No assaultive contact with B.M.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling, job search or a combination.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law. 

Imposed and stayed to be imposed at the agent's discretion and by further order of the court. 

Count 2 only.

Minutes.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Strangulation and suffocation, (DVO), on 02-03-22.

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Jorge Luis Pana Cotto, 410 E. Reed Avenue #7, Manitowoc, WI  54220
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping, strangulation/suffocation, battery and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-14-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with R.M. or D.S., defendant is to have no contact with B.M. or any premises they occupy and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
